comments:
I am trying do debug a simple class. I put break point in the main method, 
executed Run/Debug, entered project name and package name and clicked debug 
button. I got message box on my screen "Eclipse is not able to set working 
directory specified by the program being lauched as a current runtime does not 
support working directories. Continue launch without working directory."
When I click Yes, I get launch configuration exeption message.

I tried to use runtimes of different versions 1.4, 1.3 and 1.2. Result was the 
same. What should I do to fix this problem

thanks
-Boris

There are a couple problems:

1) The Eclipse runtime itself (i.e. the VM you are running the Eclipse IDE on) 
should be 1.3 or higher. You are getting the error message about the working 
directory because Eclipse is running on a 1.2.x VM
2) The next problem looks like you have started Eclipse with "tools.jar" (JDI 
implementation) that is not 1.4 compatible. Do you have a "tools.jar" on the 
Eclipse classpath? Why?

How do I change vm in eclipse to run on 1.3 vm? Do I need to get new plugin? I 
could not find any information on this. Where can I read about it? I am not 
sure what you mean started eclipse with "tools.jar". I have jre 1.3 on my class 
path but I don't set tools.jar on my class path explicitly.

thanks
-Boris

Please see the FAQ. What VM are you using?

http://www.eclipse.org/eclipse/faq/eclipse-faq.html#users_3
Closing, unless there are any more problems.
